intro: Distemonanthus laxus, commonly known as the slender sandalwood, is a small evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, yellowish-green fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
